remarks: A named lemma of Sylow's second and third theorems.  If ` G ` is a finite ` P ` -group that acts on the finite set ` Y ` , then the set ` Z ` of all points of ` Y ` fixed by every element of ` G ` has cardinality equivalent to the cardinality of ` Y ` , ` mod P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jan-2015.)
statement:

sylow2a.m $e |- ( ph -> .(+) e. ( G GrpAct Y ) ) $.
sylow2a.p $e |- ( ph -> P pGrp G ) $.
sylow2a.f $e |- ( ph -> X e. Fin ) $.
sylow2a.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. Fin ) $.
sylow2a.z $e |- Z = { u e. Y | A. h e. X ( h .(+) u ) = u } $.
sylow2a.r $e |- .~ = { <. x , y >. | ( { x , y } C_ Y /\ E. g e. X ( g .(+) x ) = y ) } $.
sylow2a $p |- ( ph -> P || ( ( # ` Y ) - ( # ` Z ) ) ) $.
